website_summaries.verdict: Gets great results on a budget. You just can't beat this unit for the money.
pros: Includes 12 steel discs for cookie shapes
A snap to disassemble and clean
cons: Two of the discs do not yield consistent results

customer_reviews.title: but my conclusion is that the OXO COOKIE GRIPS Press is a good substitute. Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Okay...while nothing will ever replace my electric cookie shooter that sadly died after 25 of faithful cookie service, I researched the world over, (they just don’t make the electric ones anymore! Why!, but my conclusion is that the OXO COOKIE GRIPS Press is a good substitute. Easy to use! Easy to clean and the see thru barrel is a must! The cookie dye I used for my spritz recipe worked out great, albeit the cookies were rather small for my desires, but a double hit on the crank fixed that by doubling the cookie in size on the sheet. Good luck! I like this shooter, it’s good.
customer_reviews.author: MLR

customer_reviews.title: YES, YOU CAN DO CHEESE STRAWS!!!
customer_reviews.text: I wrote the OXO company with the question of how to accomplish cheese straws. Unfortunately, they did not respond (frown). This makes my rating a 4 instead of 5. This was dumb luck: I extruded the mixture using the wreath disc. Clicked maybe 6 times. Sliced the pieces of dough off and twisted them, as I prefer. I like to freeze on the pan for 15 minutes, to preserve shape, then bake. Merry Christmas from Fairhope, Alabama.
customer_reviews.author: CTB

customer_reviews.title: Simply the Best
customer_reviews.text: After literally decades of trying different cookie presses, Oxo has offered the BEST cookie press, period. Bought the Oxo on the recommendation of America's Test Kitchen, and wow did they make a great one! I tried both the butter spritz & the cream cheese spritz recipes. Both recipes were delicious, but my adult kids could not stop eating the cream cheese recipe. The press works like a dream, NO duds. It is so easy to use, I'm sure that younger kids could use it. Our house will have tons of pressed cookies this holiday season.
customer_reviews.author: Gail M

customer_reviews.title: Love it!  The best choice for cookie press
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never used a cookie press before but wanted to try it out for Christmas. I was nervous that I wouldn’t be able to figure it out. I chose this particular cookie press because the handle seemed more comfortable than other models and I trust the Oxo brand. I definitely chose right! The packaging is perfect and the shapes come in a nice little plastic container (shown in product picture). The instructions are simple and it even comes with recipes. I followed one of the enclosed recipes and it turned out perfect. I got so many compliments. Definitely would make this purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly S

customer_reviews.title: Handle/ratchet off track/broken during first batch of cookies
customer_reviews.text: I've never particularly cared for Oxo products, because they usually seem awkward, are difficult to work, and break quickly, but because of such good reviews for this cookie press, I thought I'd give the company another try. The handle/ratchet mechanism on the cookie press broke during my first batch of cookies and it wouldn't work anymore. I won't by Oxo items again. At least Amazon shipped it to me very quickly, and makes it easy to return an item. Amazon convenience is worth five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: broke on first use
customer_reviews.text: I liked the Oxo for the first pan of cookies. Halfway thru the second batch, the mechanism simply stopped working. What a disappointment. I would add that it cannot be returned or exchanged. I could buy alot of cookies for $30. Done with Oxo brand.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Absolute garbage
customer_reviews.text: It broke. First time I used it. So disappointed. I don’t know where this nice review come from, but this press is cheaply made. I knew by the feel of it when I first opened the package that it would break and I ised it super carefully, because I wanted to finish the dough. I used a very soft shortbread dough I even mixed half a cup less of flour in order to be sure that the press would make it. Nope. Didn’t make it
customer_reviews.author: Renata D.

customer_reviews.title: I tried to make the Spritz cookies today, and ...
customer_reviews.text: I tried to make the Spritz cookies today, and the top would not unscrew from the cylinder, no matter what I tried. I did make the cookies by inserting the dough from the bottom, but now there is no way to clean the cylinder. IT WILL NOT UNSCREW. Worthless and $30.00 yet. I bought this 2 months in advance to be sure I got it, and bake for the holidays, and now it is too late to return it. OXO, why don't you sell things that come apart properly???? An unhappy OXO user.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works with Wilton Disks
customer_reviews.text: I had a Wilton Cookie Max Cookie Press for about 15 years and the plastic mechanism finally broke last year during my Christmas baking. When looking for a replacement, I was trying to find one that would fit my Wilton disks, so that I wouldn’t have to toss the entire set. The OXO does work with the Wilton disks (see pictures), and the handy case fits my 12 Wilton disks as well as the 12 OXO disks that come with this set.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Beall Burns

customer_reviews.title: Fragile. It snapped during the first use. The ...
customer_reviews.text: Fragile. It snapped during the first use. The product should be able to withstand the possibility of pressing with little extra force. This product apparently doesn't. Plastic is not the optimal material for the task.
customer_reviews.author: Hesham Fas

customer_reviews.title: Broke during first use😞
customer_reviews.text: I received the OXO Good Grips Cookie Press promptly and was excited to use it to make Spritz cookies like my Mom used to make. All went well with the first batch, but on the second batch it broke and would not seal closed. Sadly, I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Messy barrel?
customer_reviews.text: I really like this cookie press. I've always had the squeeze dispense presses so I was't sure I'd like it. The day it came in I just had to make some cookies. It worked beautifully with one exception. The plunger allows the dough to slip past it and sticks to the barrel or the back side of the plunger. I would have given 5 stars if it didn't have this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Honey

customer_reviews.title: Can't wait .. and we did .. and YOU are gonna ..
customer_reviews.text: We have a generations long tradition of making SPRITZ COOKIES and am so looking forward to NOT twisting the canister for every cookie. (My arm hurts just thinking about that! (We have other OXO products and they are outstanding!) UPDATE: This press put the FUN FACTOR back into our Spritz Cookie Tradition!! SOOO EASY TO USE! One 'click' and a perfect appears - every time! One of our granddaughter's even made a 'commercial' video 'promoting it' vs the old fashioned press we've been using for generations! Perfect cookie! Easy! Great selection of inserts! Easy to clean! What more can you ask for? YEAH, OXO!
customer_reviews.author: Mary W.

customer_reviews.title: Got a year out of it......
customer_reviews.text: So, we had an ancient one from either Germany or Sweden or something like that but the husband thought we should have a 'new, improved' model.....so last year we got it and make the cookies with the same recipe I've always used and it went alright; a few glitches, but on the whole, okay. Not so this year......used the tried and true recipe and 1/3 of the way into it, the unit broke inside at the 3 tabs inside that the screws go through to hold the body together. No way to repair it, either.....so it's in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Hickernell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cookie press!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product to replace my Pampered Chef cooked press (RIP), and absolutely love it. I researched a bunch of them, and this one had great reviews. I love that you just press down on the handle - as long as you don't make the dough too dry, it works very quick! I was done in no time, and I usually dread doing the Spritz cookies. This pumped them out much faster than my old press. I would recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: WisconsinMom

customer_reviews.title: Grandkids and I say it’s a TWO THUMBS UP!
customer_reviews.text: So my grandkids and I used the cookie press today since it’s only 5 degrees out. My Mia loved pressing the handle and squeezing out the cookies - almost as much as she liked eating them. Now, the grownup stuff: press was easy to assemble and clean. The handle was easy for the 4 year old to push. I used the butter cookie recipe that cane with press and had NO issues loading or pressing the cookies. All in all, a great buy that I will use a lot.
customer_reviews.author: SusanZ

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Only two things I don't really like about this cookie press. The first is that I couldn't get the cookies to release from the press onto my parchment-lined cookie sheet. I had already read that parchment paper wasn't recommended, but I did find a way around it that works for my baking. I press the cookies onto either my cutting board or a plate, then pick them up with a small spatula and place them on the parchment paper. The other thing I will mention is the recipes in the instruction book. The ginger cookies don't taste very good in my opinion, but the others are all pretty tasty.
customer_reviews.author: Maone

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these when my children were young and we loved to make the pretty pastel cookies at Christmas. I thought it would be fun to get the grandchildren involved in cookie baking this holiday season however i could not operate this unit with any ease and so after several attempts and much wasted ingredients, I donated it to a church yard sale . Very disappointed .
customer_reviews.author: Debi

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have always wanted to try to make Spritz cookies so, finally gave it a shot with this highly recommended press. It was easy to use and did the trick! (As a suggestion to anyone trying to make spritz, skip the parchment paper if your cookies aren't sticking to it and go directly on the cookie sheet. Took me quite awhile to figure out why my spritz weren't working when every recipe suggested parchment paper).
customer_reviews.author: momtimes3

customer_reviews.title: Ahh!
customer_reviews.text: I had given up on cookie presses...hard to use, hard to create uniform cookies, hard to clean. Thought I would give it one more try. Glad I did! This press is just what I had hoped for. The cookies are very pretty, the designs are distinct ( I really like the Fleur de Lis!) I probably will only use this at holidays, but it might tempt me to go beyond! I used one of the recipes in the booklet...very buttery, not too sweet..just right. ( I used all vanilla,no almond flavoring, but that is personal preference.)
customer_reviews.author: cavipo

customer_reviews.title: Cookies come out perfect even on the first try! Kinda small though
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great cookie press! I grew up with a Pampered Chef one and it was always difficult to get the perfect cookie until you get into a flow and a bunch of mess-up cookies. This one pops out perfect cookies every single time and is SUPEr easy to use and fill up! I love it! The only con is that the cookies are a lot smaller than other Spritz cookies I've seen/made, but still good - you can always get different size disks. I love the little case the disks came in too and that there's a teddy bear one - so cute!
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Easy gun with tasty recipes included.
customer_reviews.text: I liked that the design's for the cookie shaped are a good variety. It included very yummy recipes. I used the gingerbread shortbread. I found that when my dough had been re-created a number of times it became as expected, super soft. So I used one of the molds and shot out a long continuous ribbon onto the cookie sheet and cut to desired amount. These cookies at the end were crunchy outside and soft inside. Easy gun. Tasty cookies.
customer_reviews.author: susan ryan

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic snapped
customer_reviews.text: Broke on 4th use. I did buy this around Christmas 2014. Used once a year at holidays. Today, brought it out and it broke such that it won’t seal and stay closed to apply pressure to squeeze out dough. Dough always has had trouble sticking to the pan/paper no matter which recipe I used so today I chilled the dough and apparently too much. Heard a loud snap with no warning, plastic snapped apart and screws still attached inside. No fixing that mess. My fault for over chilling dough but shouldn’t this thing just stop and not snap if sought oo stuff? Never had a problem with my mom’s old electric press.
customer_reviews.author: NYCPrime

customer_reviews.title: Did the job
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use but holding the barrel with one hand and pushing down on the lever with another requires a lot of grip and after a bit is not as easy as an automatic (like my old trusty super shooter). However when my automatic one broke this worked on a pinch and got the job done. The discs are smaller then the week ever super shooter so not able to interchange and the patterns aren't the best but did the job and had it delivered next day.
customer_reviews.author: cakebaker83

customer_reviews.title: Best Cookie Press!
customer_reviews.text: Can’t say enough good things about this cookie press. I’ve always used either an electric or battery operated one. I was afraid that I wouldn’t be able to press down hard enough on the handle to get the cookie dough out. Wow, was I wrong....it’s so very, very, easy and the design of this cookie press controls just how much dough comes out! You get a perfect cookie with every press!!! Add to this that there is a quality storage case for the disks and it’s a hands down winner. I loved it so much that I bought one as a gift too.
customer_reviews.author: Aces

customer_reviews.title: Would've gotten 5 stars but...
customer_reviews.text: Okay so 3 years and 4 days after I bought this cookie press I finally used it for the first time and I love it!! It is so easy to use, refill and take apart and I really like the storage case for the disks. The only reason it didn't get 5 stars is because the whole thing is not dishwasher safe. It says that the tube and the stainless steel disks are the only things that are and the other parts you have to hand wash but other than that, it's awesome!!
customer_reviews.author: LL Goad

customer_reviews.title: but we had a terrible time getting them to drop off the disc
customer_reviews.text: I bought the press at the urging of my daughter who had made spritz cookies many years ago. I don’t know, maybe it was the recipe we used, maybe the dough needed to be chilled, but we had a terrible time getting them to drop off the disc. Many ended up back in the bowl. I won’t attempt to use it again, so I’ll give it to her.
customer_reviews.author: BETSY

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I'm not using it correctly
customer_reviews.text: I followed the recipe for butter cookies that came with the press. However, when you try to press anything out, it all becomes a squished blob. We ended up rolling the cookie dough out and using plain old cookie cutters. On the off chance, it was just me, I was able to easily wash the press and maybe I'll try it again. Maybe not. On the plus side, the recipe booklet that came with it made some great xmas cookies. Glad it wasn't that expensive... I wouldn't buy it again and I wouldn't recommend the press.
customer_reviews.author: C. Maltese

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product
customer_reviews.text: The OXO cookie press was recommended by America's Test Kitchen. I wanted to make Christmas cookies and thought this would be fun to try. It completely comes apart so cleaning it is a breeze. Getting the dough to pack down evenly was challenging. It seems like the consistency of the dough is tricky - even a little "off" and it either won't go through the disks or the design is hard to see. I'm guessing that practice will improve the results!
customer_reviews.author: kh808

customer_reviews.title: So easy
customer_reviews.text: I grew up using my mom's old electric cookie press from the 70s. You had to know just how long to press the button so the right about of dough would come out. This one takes all the guess work out of it. It's easy to put together and use. After the first cookie or so (that first little bit never comes out perfectly) all the rest come out with exactly the same amount of dough, with just one press on the lever. I also love all the different disks that come with it, and having a handy little storage case for them is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Ferreira

customer_reviews.title: Very nice cookie press!!
customer_reviews.text: This will be the third cookie press I have owned in my lifetime and so far it is the nicest. At Christmas my family loves making (and eating) almond spritz cookies so that is primarily what we use it for. It was very easy to use and made the cookies with great detail, something my other presses lacked. It dispenses just the right amount of dough for a perfectly shaped cookie every time. Also very durable and easy to clean. I love the little container it comes with to organize the different cookie templates - no more keeping the box forever or digging around in the drawer. Two thumbs up!!
customer_reviews.author: Alina Graves

customer_reviews.title: I chose this one because I am getting older and I think the lever (up and down) motion was the best for me
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews and went on You tube to see what I could find about all the different Cookie Presses. I chose this one because I am getting older and I think the lever (up and down) motion was the best for me. I was right. What a joy to pump out these cookies and they are fun to decorate. I also bought one for my granddaughter who loves to bake. She was delightfully surprised and is enjoying it as much as I am. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Fun & easy!  Excellent to make holiday or  little tea cookies
customer_reviews.text: I think this actually worked better than the Wilton one I used to have and lost somehow when I moved. Easy way to make little cookies with shapes if your busy schedule does not allow enough time for full on cut-out cookies. We have a recipe that includes jello for additional flavor/color and we love it! Makes p.o perfect cookies for an afternoon tea!
customer_reviews.author: Larissa Allen

customer_reviews.title: Hate it
customer_reviews.text: Useless. The dough sticks to the bottom. Doesn’t. Do the job.
customer_reviews.author: queenbag

customer_reviews.title: Invest for better quality than this
customer_reviews.text: This was my second one after the first one fell apart. This one did the same. I have made my dough looser, tougher, and still the same result. Seriously the only shape this thing turns out are boob shaped cookies. Great for Breast Cancer Awareness Month, not great for the holidays. I will avoid this brand from here on out.
customer_reviews.author: brenaugrl11

customer_reviews.title: Does not have star tip and cookies are somewhat small but easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I like this cookie press. Its very easy to use and come with a great case holder for the disks. I bought this to replace my Cookies shooter. This does not have a star tip to pipe your own cookies but it does have some great disks. The first cookie I made was a shortbread cookie using the wreath disk. When the cookies cooled I put raspberry jam in between two cookies and dipped them in chocolate. They were delicious! I would recommend :)
customer_reviews.author: robin listorti

customer_reviews.title: Quality cookie press!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great cookie press! Very sturdy and very easy to use. The clear tube makes it so easy to see how much dough is left. The stainless steel disks are durable! I tried a different brand, less expensive, before returning it for this product. The other brand's disks bent during the first use. These are high quality, & very strong. A great product that makes amazing cookies quickly. Highly recommend this cookie press!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kakoskee

customer_reviews.title: Dough will not stick to parchment paper, punch directly onto cookie sheet!
customer_reviews.text: Took a few tries to get the hang of using this, but once I got going, it was very easy! You have to punch them out directly onto the cookie sheet, will not work to punch out onto parchment paper. The dough doesn’t stick and will not come off the press as it should. Just a tip - once I realized that was the issue and punched them directly onto the cookie sheet, it was so easy! A nice product!
customer_reviews.author: Tony Mevoli

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have arthritic hands so I was looking for a cookie press that would be easy to use and this one fits the bill. I used the butter cookie recipe included in the package and got rave reviews. A couple of tips - watch your baking time closely. I found 6 minutes was perfect. Also, don’t grease your pan at all or the dough won’t stick enough to come away from the press.
customer_reviews.author: PeggyC

customer_reviews.title: Great cookie press!
customer_reviews.text: Great cookie press! I have owned and used other brands and styles, and this one really is comfortable to use. I like the contoured grip area at the top, it really does help you to hold the press in a comfortable, ergonomic way. The ratcheting feature is easy to use and worked really well. The silicone feature at the bottom is a nice design, but be careful if using this on a silicone mat, I had a few cookies refuse to stick and occasionally the press slipped a little. Otherwise, this produced even, beautiful cookies. I love the plastic box for disc storage, what a great idea! Really worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Raindrop

customer_reviews.title: works well, but didn't last
customer_reviews.text: it is easy to clean and seems easier to fill than other cookie presses I've used. As with all presses, not all the cookies come out perfect and the dough and temperature make a difference in how well it will work. After owning this press for a while and making cookies with it maybe 5 or 6 times, I ended up breaking the handle right off. I was using just the standard dough and it was soft, at room temperature. I don't think I was putting any extra pressure on the handle. It just snapped off in my hand making the whole thing unusable.
customer_reviews.author: calculus teacher

customer_reviews.title: Does not last long...
customer_reviews.text: We only made 5 batches of cookies before having a catastrophic failure. The handle broke off completely at th 3 screws that held the handle on. It was a great design in regards to being ergonomically easy to use, just a shame that it didn’t hold up for long use.
customer_reviews.author: Karen M. Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Still looking for a good press
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been searching for a good cookie press and this isn’t it. The ratcheting system either doesn’t catch half the time or slips causing it to make an awful sound as if the press is breaking in two. It didn’t give me hand cramps like the squeeze action presses, but I constantly had to put pressure on the plunger to get anything to move through the press. Some of the shapes didn’t work at all and the others came out lopsided because the dough wasn’t pressed through evenly. I will continue my search for a well designed press.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn D Koethke

customer_reviews.title: Great press!
customer_reviews.text: Like everything about this press. It's so easy on your hands, cuts dough off crisply and very little excess dough left in tube. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: MSJ

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Great cookie press. Easy to use. I love the storage case for the cookie press discs.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky J

customer_reviews.title: Great cookie press!
customer_reviews.text: I had a Super Shooter cookie press that finally quit working and decided to buy the OXO. I love it! It is very easy to use, a lot easier than my old Super Shooter. The cookies come out of the press uniformly. I am very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Judi Hiegel

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy enough — broke on first use.
customer_reviews.text: Made one batch of nice cookies and then broke. The tube separated from the handle. Consider a metal model.
customer_reviews.author: Jason L.

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this one for years and bought another for my grand daughters to learn to make their own cookies. It works great, as long as you follow the recipes. Don’t chill dough before pressing. Easy to clean, makes quick work of cookies.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary Dean

customer_reviews.title: Best and easiest cookie press ever made
customer_reviews.text: I have been baking for 50 years and have always made spritz cookies as part of my holiday cookies. I’m now 70 years old and gave my cookie press to one of my daughters last year because I could no longer “fight” it with my arthritic hands. I was looking at new designs and could tell that the ergonomics of this press would allow me to make spritz cookies again this year. This is a FABULOUS press. I would give it a hundred stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: freddy

customer_reviews.title: Jammed and malfunctioned constantly
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't push out dough no matter what I tried. Cookies ended up looking terrible. Then it jammed and I couldn't unscrew the top to get the dough out or clean it. Had to let it sit out and dry up to break it loose. Very disappointed. This is supposed to be one of the best out there, but it's nowhere near as good as my mom's 20+ yr old one.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson13

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. Used this a total of 3 times over the last year. It was already janky after the first use - lots of slippage between presses. And then today it full on broke. I spent the extra money on this thinking good grips would make a quality product. Lame. I'll go back to buying the cheap cookie presses. At least those latest a couple of years before crapping out.
customer_reviews.author: Boo

customer_reviews.title: Love this Cookie Press by OXO
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised with my Oxo cookie press! My old cookie press has become so hard to use. When I received my Oxo, I whipped up a batch of my Mothers Spritz cookie recipe and filled the tube...so easy to press, no resistance and perfect cookies...so happy with your product!!
customer_reviews.author: Susan F.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I usually like the products from this company but I had a rather miserable time trying to extrude cheese straws from it. Not that the extrusion itself was difficult but that there was no really good extruding plate.
customer_reviews.author: Philippe Jeanty

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: I broke, on average, one cookie press every two years. This one has lasted me quite a while. The disks are metal, which helps in its durability. Very easy to use. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Cookie Press
customer_reviews.text: This cookie press is easy to use and also easy to clean. I made the chocolate cookie recipe that came with the cookie press. We pressed out hearts for Valentine's Day and they were so easy to make. The dough came out easily and all cookies were uniform. The only issue I ran into was the cookies needed to be directly on the pan and not on parchment paper. My kids can't wait to make more cookies with me.
customer_reviews.author: SomeColoradoGuyandGal

customer_reviews.title: Great cookie press!
customer_reviews.text: I have been making cookies with a cookie press for almost 50 years and I’ve had a few good presses but more not so good. I am happy to say that this is the best one that I have ever had. It is so easy to use. It makes perfect cookies and it comes with a good selection of designs. It is also easy to clean. I wouldn’t hesitate to buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Broke shortly after buying it
customer_reviews.text: while I like the cookie press, it broke shortly after I bought it. If you read the reviews, a certain percentage just seem to break immediately while others last for years. Guess i just got unlucky.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: This cookie press is fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: I would give it 10 stars if I could. It is a gem. Easy to operate, no mess, comes apart to clean. After buying, stupidly, two presses from lousy Chinese resellers, I found this one and this is the only one to have.
customer_reviews.author: MadMax

customer_reviews.title: I thought it would be nice as I love pressed cookies and have arthritic hands ...
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would be nice as I love pressed cookies and have arthritic hands but I couldn't make it work at all! The dough wouldn't release from the metal extrusion plate and I eventually took everything apart and used my old one. I don't think it presses out enough dough and there is no 'in-between' setting. Also, a little dough got into the threads while putting the top on the second attempt and I had to find another person to hold the bottom while I tried in vain to loosen the top. I finally tossed the whole mess. The cost of this would have purchased several dozen similar cookies from the grocery store bakery.
customer_reviews.author: Mary A. Denney

customer_reviews.title: Not good for people who have arthritis. Too much trouble to use.
customer_reviews.text: The plunger is a bit difficult to use. It takes too much hand strength for me with my tendinitis and arthritis. My first cookies didn't turn out but probably because I didn't use their recipe. I'm not very motivated to try again and I feel stuck with it because I've had it for awhile.
customer_reviews.author: mary

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been making spritz cookies forever....started with a hand me down that you had to twist, and you got maybe one good cookie out of six! Frustrating and time consuming to say the least. I’ve had a few other cookie presses since that one, but this one is my new favorite! Perfect cookies every time!
customer_reviews.author: P. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: The OXO Cookie Press works! I am amazed for in the past I have purchased many cookies presses and all were not easy to operate. Yesterday I successfully made dozens of spritz cookie using many of the different discs from OXO. Merry Christmas to all of my family and friends who will receive perfectly made spritz cookies.
customer_reviews.author: Irissa

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic tool for making spritz cookies
customer_reviews.text: A fabulous tool for making adorable cookies without having to mess with cookie cutters. I used it to make several kinds of gluten free spritz cookies and had success when I refrigerated the baking sheets before attempting to press the dough.
customer_reviews.author: YellowWallpaperGirl

customer_reviews.title: Product support didn't help at all.
customer_reviews.text: Looking forward to this item after reading the reviews, I was very unhappy to see how this press work. Even with the dough at the perfect consistency, the crank and just didn't push the cookies out well without wiggling and jiggling the presser and many cookies had to be redone. Product support seemed understanding and said there must be something wrong with the press. They told me to discard it and they would ship a new one that would arrive in 5 days. Thank was 20 days ago.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super easy and cleans easily too!
customer_reviews.text: OXO does it again with a great product. I finally retired my old press from childhood and bought this one. The easy to use click and dispense is the best thing ever! Super easy to clean and has a nice box for the shapes :)
customer_reviews.author: mycowmoo

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase. My last Cookie shooter finally gave out from exhaustion! I was worried about the press being stressful on my hands but it was so easy to use. As with any cookie shooter you have to get the feel for how much pressure to use. I found that it worked great with one and a quarter pumps. The cookies stayed on the cookie pan (with parchment) unlike what some people said in reviews. I made two quick batches for this years holiday season and it was effortless!
customer_reviews.author: Mac13mug

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic press. I was hesitant to purchase at first because I was used to an electric press and feared hand fatigue but boy was I wrong. This press is super easy to use and requires very little effort. One click and you have perfectly portioned dough. It is very easy to unscrew the cover to add more dough or to switch design disks and comes apart nicely for easy cleaning. I have made numerous recommendations to friends on this product and will continue. I am very happy with it. The disk storage is a nice bonus and is large enough to store additional disks not included should you purchase the other seasonal sets available.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa B

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Thought I'd try something new for Christmas cookie baking and this was so fun and easy to use! Family loved all the designs this baby can make. Easy to assemble and use and clean up. Added food coloring for some and mixed it up a bit. Recommend if you really wanna strut yer stuff and show off with some cool cookies!
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: It's OK
customer_reviews.text: That's what my wife said, it's OK. She went on to say it's a little clumsy to operate and that it doesn't feel sturdy. It feels like it is going to break at any time. She only made one batch of cookies with it. It was the last batch. We bought this press to replace an older one that broke before she finished baking. I think I'm more disappointed than she is since I spent hours on Amazon reading reviews about all of these presses and this one seemed like a decent one. The jury is still out but this one might be going back.
customer_reviews.author: Grandpa45

customer_reviews.title: Good but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Cookie presses are finicky, and that's just the way it is. I bought this to replace an older cookie press, hoping after reading the other reviews that it would be the answer to all my problems. Unfortunately, it's not. It's a well-made and well-designed press, but it still has the flaws of your standard cookie press. I find it hard to get the dough going, and I have to pump multiple times sometimes to get the cookies to form, even using the recipes included in the pamphlet. Sadly, I don't think there's a better option out there on the market, so all of us festive spritz cookie lovers are going to have to stick with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca T

customer_reviews.title: Not a durable product
customer_reviews.text: Used once, and shaft bent and now it doesn’t work properly. Won’t buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Poor product
customer_reviews.text: This cookie press was the #1 rated press on Amazon. It did not live up to the raves. It does not release the cookies at all. I tried to use all the different patterns and made 2 different cookie doughs. The chamber is hard to turn to clean. This press was a big waste of money. It’s going in useless stuff box ......
customer_reviews.author: Jill M. Colantonio

customer_reviews.title: Best ever cookie press
customer_reviews.text: I just received this OXO cookie press. First I went with the Oxo name If anyone needs a Christmas present for a baker I highly recommend this product. I am not getting paid to write this. The quality is great . You will see this as soon as you open the box. This is the reason I buy Oxo. You may pay a little more but you won't have to buy another one. I always believe. You get what you pay for. The price. It doesn't get any better than this
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best cookie press ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best cookie press ever! I’ve never experienced a better cookie press. My 11 year old granddaughter and her 7 year old brother were able to use the press with ease and loved using it too. They have made star and heart spaced cookies. The recipes excluded with the press are terrific and very very tasty!
customer_reviews.author: Elwood Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Not a Good Cookie Press
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cookie press to make a family recipe. When I would get the dough to come out it barely came out. The shapes were not clear and it was very difficult. I ended up pressing it myself with a rolling pin. It was very disappointing. It is made to be "easier" but it was not easy. I am very disappointed with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t have a star disc
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice. I think after time I could see it breaking. The problem I have is it doesn’t show you the disc that it comes with and I make cheese straws often and it doesn’t come with the correct star disc. I found one the “works” but it is not the traditional one that usually comes with a cookie press.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Callaway

customer_reviews.title: Nice gadget for cookie lovers
customer_reviews.text: Had fun making lots of cute cookies with this cookie press. It takes a bit of trial and error to get the hang of gettting the dough to release and stick to pan, but with practice works fine. Came with 12 disks with wide variety of shapes. Cookies came out nice though much smaller than I expected. Great gadget for making decorative cookies.
customer_reviews.author: CCSings

customer_reviews.title: very nice, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the last cookie press I will ever need/use. Very simple to use/load/wash. I have used several different styles over many years, some manual, some electric. The fact that this one is one click per cookie takes the guess work out of making a seasonal favorite cookie, the spritz. You will be happy with this cookie press.
customer_reviews.author: Dr P.

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my Grandmother's cookie press which was quite old, but still worked well until my puppy chewed it up. This one is so much easier to use!!! It is easy to get the cookies uniform in size since it is a trigger that you pull to spit out a cookie. That being said, the cookies are smaller than other presses which is OK, but if you are using a favorite recipe , you will need to teak and adjust your baking times. I ruined my first couple of batches. It is compact and stores easily. I highly recommend this press!!
customer_reviews.author: Sue H.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works well. I’ve only tried 4 of the shapes and 3 worked well for me. I couldn’t get the teddy bears to work but i might just need a different dough to test it with. Added a picture of the die because no one else did and I took a gamble on wether or not I would like this set 🤷🏼‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: Miranda

customer_reviews.title: wish it was electric like my old one
customer_reviews.text: I had a different brand that was electric that was a gift 35 years ago. The motor just stopped and couldn't be repaired. I tried a different brand than the OXO and hated it. This OXO cookie press works quite well but I miss my electric cookie press!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use + storage disc container great!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm thrilled with this purchase. Made cookies over the holiday which was so enjoyable and a great addition to my cookie gift plate. I very much appreciate the way the discs are housed together for easy storage. For the cost, the product design all the components are well-made and easy to use, just like most OXO products are!
customer_reviews.author: anniehaz

customer_reviews.title: Finally a well designed cookie press
customer_reviews.text: Finally a well designed cookie press. Easy to fill and even easier to pop out cookie after perfect cookie. I've been thru several versions of the cookie press, from hand turn to battery operated to electric and none lasted very long and all were difficult to use. This OXO is wonderful. Very happy that I decided to give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: Rose O'gorman

customer_reviews.title: Works great and fun to use!
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this once so far, but I had great success.. I used the included recipe that uses cream cheese and the cookies turned out great. Follow a previous suggestion of chilling your baking sheets. (It was cold outside, so I put them out there to chill.) Don’t use parchment paper. Have fun with it. Would be fun to do with kids.
customer_reviews.author: Annette Wilson

customer_reviews.title: quality
customer_reviews.text: The cookie cutter is made extremely well..It's just hard to get the hang of using one. This one works better than the others I've purchased
customer_reviews.author: Janet Turner

customer_reviews.title: Definitely progress1
customer_reviews.text: I used the vintage cookie press for years. This year, I found I no longer had the grip necessary to squeeze out the dough. I heard good things about the press, and am very glad I bought it. Easy to use and to clean. The case the disks fit in is a great benefit to storing the designs and keeping them clean.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Astle

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made and was not worth even donating to a charity
customer_reviews.text: We grew up with cookie presses. Age and arthritis dictated the need for one that was easier to use. Generally have good luck with OXO Good Grips products so we bought one in time for Christmas. Followed directions and the recipe for butter cookies that was provided with the unit. It worked for 1/2 of the first batch but then handle started jamming and coming apart. We threw it away. If there was a rating of less than one star we would have used it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: Well-designed, which I expect from Oxo. Chose this cookie press based on reviews, previous experience with Oxo tools, and because the disks are stainless steel. Have never used another cookie press other than the terrible one we had growing up, but on its first outing this one was easy to use and the recipe from the instruction booklet (chocolate shortbread) was tasty.
customer_reviews.author: Pizzercat

customer_reviews.title: not working well
customer_reviews.text: I tried three times with receipt provided, hard to release the cookie or not able to get whole cookie out. My daughter likes bear very much, but hardly get a full bear. Every time ended of using cookie cutter, much easier! I souldn't buy this, also the shipping took around 2 weeks during Xmas time even with Prime.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful baking tool!
customer_reviews.text: I love this cookie press. Cookies come out even and without any sticking. I’ve been using cookie presses for 60 years, and this is by far the best ever.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne42431

customer_reviews.title: Best cookie Press
customer_reviews.text: This unit is the best. I have broken several because of the thickness of an old family butter cookie recipe. This press is easy to use, easy to clean and love the storage unit for the different shape discs. It is didn’t show any stress on the collar.
customer_reviews.author: Bargainpat

customer_reviews.title: Pack your patience with this cookie press
customer_reviews.text: I really did want to like press based on the reviews. Cookies are so difficult to come out of press. Ended up using dough to make cutout cookies. Feel I have wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: Bea

customer_reviews.title: One excellent cookie press...
customer_reviews.text: This press is easy to load and press out the cookies... Having the press handle on the top of the press instead of a trigger handle mechanism is easier on the user and a more stable mechanism... the dies are easy to change as well... Overall we are very pleased with this cookie press...
customer_reviews.author: Nickolas

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use
customer_reviews.text: I used this product for Spritz cookies. I love that it has metal disks, mainly because the last one I had had plastic disks and the one I used the most, the Christmas tree, cracked and was no longer usable. I also love the case the disks came in. Every cookie came out the appropriate size and was so easy to use the handle. I recommend this product very highly.
customer_reviews.author: James M. Linde

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: SUCH a good press to use when you have arthritic hands! Very easy - just LOVE it! Fast & easy & easy to clean. Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: V. Hobson

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT
customer_reviews.text: Just made my cookies with it today. Super easy to use...cleaned up well. Love the case that holds the rings. Very happy. Doesn't seem like it will break easy
customer_reviews.author: D.JH

customer_reviews.title: Great cookie press
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised at how easy this was to use. I was replacing a decades old cookie press that I thought was irreplaceable. It was easy to use, made perfect cookies and was easy to clean. Hopefully this one will last decades!
customer_reviews.author: LORI

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This cookie press works very well and is easy to use. I wish the entire device could be washed in the dishwasher though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cookies
customer_reviews.text: Broke 2nd time I used it called OXO and are sending replacement free. Love the cookie designs and disk holding case.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Makes perfect cookies
customer_reviews.text: I made perfect wreath cookies for Christmas. The butter recipe in the enclosed booklet excellent (much better than my sister's press cookies). The cookies are small, dainty, which I like.
customer_reviews.author: Phoebe

product_meta.title: OXO Good Grips Cookie Press with Stainless Steel Disks and Storage Case,White,100
product_meta.description: Style Name:Cookie PressCreate batches of fun, consistent cookies with the OXO Good Grips Cookie Press. The large, contoured lever is easy to grip and the non-slip base keeps the Press steady while dispensing dough. The clear cylindrical barrel shows how much dough remains and disassembles for easy loading and cleaning. With 12 Stainless Steel Cookie Disk patterns included, you'll be prepared for any occasion.
feature_bullets: Non-slip base keeps Press steady while dispensing dough
Comfortable lever designed for repetitive use with Press dimensions: 5.75 x 2.75 x 10.25 inches and storage case dimensions : 2 x 5 x 2.1 inches
Clear cylinder shows remaining dough, disassembles for easy loading and cleaning
Includes Storage Case with 12 Stainless Steel Disks: Daisy, Flower, Sunflower, Fleur-de-lis, Butterfly, Bear, Shell, Leaf, Heart, Snowflake, Tree and Wreath

The OXO Better Guarantee: If you experience an issue with your OXO product, get in touch with us for a repair or replacement. We’re grateful for the opportunity to learn from your experience, and we’ll make it better

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,324 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
specifications.Warranty Description: Satisfaction guarantee: if for any reason you are not satisfied with this product, return it for repair, replacement or refund.
